notesStmt.note: Folios 17v, 23r have censor's erasures. Luigi da Bologna, a converted Jew working for the Inquisition as a censor (fl. 1590 - 1609): inscribed with his name: Revisto per mi Fra Luigi del ordine de Sa' Domenico setembr del (15)91 (folio 184v). See 104. Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (fl. 1600-1624): inscribed with his name, 1618 (folio 183v); see 100-101.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Abraham ibn Ezra on the Pentateuch.

collation.p: 19 quires: i8, ii-xviii10, xix6. Quires marked with catchwords on the last page and signed with Hebrew letters on the first and last pages.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of the early 15th century. Shem Ṭov ben Shemu᾿el Barukh: inscribed with his name in the colophon, together with Shelomoh Yedidyah ben Matatyah, with a date of 5161 (1401), folio 184v.
